question: Socio-religious reform movements in western India were led by some very illustrious personalities, the incorrect statement in this context is:
option1: Gopal Hari Deshmukh was one of the earliest religious reformers who rationally attacked hindu orthodox beliefs.
option2: Bal Gangadhar was a great Indian nationalist who revived the faith of Indians in their rich cultural heritage by celebration of Shivaji and Ganesh festival in Maharashtra.
option3: Dr Atmaram Pandurang and Justice Ranade, founded the Prarthana Samaj in Maharashtra, inspired by the Brahmo Samaj and espousing principles of enlightened theism based on the ancient Vedas.
option4: Justice Ranade and Pandita Ramabai were pioneers of women’s education in India.
answer: Justice Ranade and Pandita Ramabai were pioneers of women’s education in India.
explanation: Jyotiba Phule and his wife Savitribai Phule were pioneers of women’s education in India.
